titleStmt.title: The fryer well fitted; or, A pretty jest that once befell, how a maid put a fryer to cool in a well. To a merry tune.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for W. Thackeray, and T. Passinger.,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "As I lay musing all alone ..."
Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library and the British Library.
